Reviews.Title: “Needs a bit more !”
Reviews.Author: MorganME
Reviews.Content: Hotel Modern was a bit different. Although recently renovated.. seemingly just the rooms, because the Main Entrance leaves a LOT to be desired. First when arriving no one was in the reception area to greet you...no one. Secondly you stand at a wooden box with nothing on it, not even a pen to sign with. Very odd. Check out is at 11am and Check in is at 4:00pm however, several Customers had to wait another 45 minutes to get a room. One person told us the cleaning staff was short, and the Manager (finally appeared) said that was not true. Giving them the benefit of a doubt due to hurricane Isaac, they seemed very unorganized, and poorly managed. Being aware of the hurricane issues, myself and other guests called ahead and was told everything was running normal, power had never been off and they were at full capacity, and to "come on down". The experience was quite different. They seemed very understaffed and befuzzled. We were told they were trying to help locals who were out of power, but doing so by giving them our booked,...paid for rooms, seemed a bit unfair. I don't want to be too harsh here, because helping others is good, but i get the feeling this hotel has problems. Your room is stocked with everything, and this is because they have no offering of vending of any type. They also have no coffee makers in the rooms, no iron or ironing boards, and best of all with heat and humidity that NOLA has, NO ICE MACHINES. Now you can get anything you need by calling the front box, however, then you must go down and get it, OR wait for them to bring it to your room. Modern....???? Seems modern would have had current ammenities and then some wouldn't you think. I'm kinda of speechless on this place. I was on the 10th floor which made needing things a bit tough. Jennifer was very good at explaining why rooms were late getting into, however, why no ammenities? Very few people wants to pay for mini bar prices in their rooms. Oh, and lastly, the view from my window were the local homeless drunks, sleeping under the statue of General Lee. How nice. On my second night there, one was sleeping just feet from the Hotel entrance. You be the judge,...I'm just sharing my experience.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO! Price Gouging during hurricanes!!”
Reviews.Author: laura l
Reviews.Content: During hurricane isaac, they completely overcharged me! $270 for a $95 room, they charged my account right away, I wasn't prepared to pay that much because that was not what we discussed! They wouldn't refund me the money, and now I have no $$, no house, no electricity, everything was destroyed in the hurricane. What a horrible person and horrible hotel. I would never stay there again, and I would never recommend anyone else stay there again!!!! Price gouging is highly illegal, and how could someone take advantage of people during a national crisis???

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel all the way around!”
Reviews.Author: Viva_La_Viajera
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel by complete chance; the hotel we were originally booked at cancelled our reservation. At almost 8pm I found availability at this hotel and called the hotel directly to confirm availability. The man that I spoke with quickly informed me that there were indeed 3 king rooms available. When is asked if the price was the same as the Orbiz quote, he suggested that I confirm the room on Orbtiz as there was a price difference. We arrived about 10 minutes after receiving the confirmation email to a very friendly valet. He walked us into the hotel while explaining the check in process. Shortly he was joined by another man, presumably the concierge, who told us to wait in adjacent sitting area and offered us a glass of wine. There was a choice of chardonnay or cabernet sauvignon and both were very high quality. For those who don't drink that was lemon infused ice water. A woman came over to us and asked for our information; as I explained that we had booked our rooms less than 15 minutes earlier, she apologized for the other hotel's incompetence and asked for my name to locate our rooms. She returned in a short time and informed us that we were checked in and she hoped that we enjoyed our stay. The style of the hotel is modern, but eclectic and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. The room was small and clean. The decor was simple and linear, but the addition of stacked books, a small oil painting of a swamp scene, and a decorative glass candy bowl continued with the modern/eclectic vibe. The minibar is overpriced but that is to be expected. Thankfully there is a gas station on the other side of the circle which has a large selection of beer, wine, and hard liquor at very reasonable prices. Add a bucket of ice from room service (there aren't any ice machines) and you have a party! The shower has good water pressure and the C.O. Bigelow products, lavender and peppermint, were fantastic after a long day touring. Our room was on the second floor above the bar/night club. The music was very audible in the bathroom, but less so in the room. The club is open until 2am, but it seemed like the music continued until 2:30-3am. We were not disturbed by it as we returned to the room after midnight, both nights, and were exhausted from walking the Quarter all day. However, it was loud enough that it may disturb other guests. Also, it is quite a long walk to the French Quarter. It took about 15 minutes to get to Canal street, which borders the western edge of the French Quarter. We were usually game to walk, but did take a taxi on Saturday night at the reasonable cost of $12 (for 4 people). All in all it was a very enjoyable stay and we will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite NOLA hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Catherine A
Reviews.Content: At first glance, this new hotel doesn't seem very "New Orleans," though it is located on Lee Circle and has taken the spot once occupied by a famous NOLA establishment. I don't know whether they call themselves "boutique," but their sharp stylishness seems to invoke Park Slope rather than the Belle Epoque. The hotel is new and everything is lovely and fresh. (I swear our room had that "new hotel smell".) "Boutique" means the rooms aren't huge, but they have lots of clever features, such as moveable side tables, to compensate. It's all about style and service--striking color schemes, fresh white beds, refrigerators, etc. The Modern's hipness is apparent from the minute you enter the place--your "check-in desk" is a simple table and the process is very personal and warm. Hipness continues in Tamarind, the new restaurant attached to the hotel. The Asian-French fusion food would make the eatery destination dining in any world capital. The free breakfast is the usual juice-coffee-pastries deal you get, but because this IS New Orleans, the pastries are gorgeous, little fresh, filled croissants. You can come down for coffee or request a coffeemaker in your room. Location is great, with museums just around the corner. And Commander's isn't far! So--if you associate New Orleans hotels with gently crumbling facades and lots of period touches, the Hotel Modern doesn't fit the mold. But it is true that when you check in, they offer you a glass of wine. And how many hotels have a scarlet parrot, named "Scarlett," in the lobby to greet you? The personal service is exceptional, the vibe is chic high-style, and there's room for eccentricity. Maybe it IS New Orleans after all! Having been lucky enough to marry into a New Orleans family, I get to go a few times a year. And the Modern is my new favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: janellbb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a night at Hotel Modern just to visit the city. It has quickly become my favorite hotel in a city that I visit often. The reservations manager Jenn was so helpful and put us in a great room overlooking Lee Circle. Since the recent name change and remodel the hotel has become a mix of European sophistication and Southern hospitality. The staff is so friendly and knows so much about the city, places to eat and things to see. It's an easy walk to the French Quarter or an $8.00 cab ride. You can also ride the historic New Orleans street car for $1.25, The car stop is right near the hotel. Our room was clean, the A/C was very cold and we had plenty of towels. Giavanna who works at check in was so sweet. Actually, the entire staff that we saw was friendly and professional. The only disappointment was that Scarlett, the parrot who lives in the lobby, is ill and so was not available to play with. She is taking a break and will be back soon. If you have stayed here when the hotel was Hotel LeCirque you will love the remodel. If this is your first visit to Hotel Modern it won't be your last. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good option if you don't want to be in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: JackWonderful
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights while on holiday in N.O. The hotel is very well located, being almost halfway between the French Quarter and the Garden District, and also on the main trolley route. (I arrived in the city by train and the hotel is a ten minute walk from the Amtrak station). It's an easy fifteen minute walk to the start of the French Quarter and about the same to the Garden District. Although on a traffic circle the area is quiet. The National WWII museum is literally around the corner. Reception is unusual in that there is a very informal desk offering wine or a cold drink. I was met by a polite staff member for check in and the process was quick. The only concern I had was that my credit card was taken for incidentals, but instead of swiping at the desk it was taken around the back and out of sight - presumably because that is where the machine is - not best practice for the handling of cards. The room was on the small side but not uncomfortably so. There was plenty of space for bag storage by the door or in the cupboard. The room had a fully stocked minibar, but as usual the prices were ridiculous (especially when there is a convenience store right across the street). Bed was comfortable and the bathroom was fine. The room had a safe which worked fine. Good-sized TV with plenty of channels (but no list of channels in my room). Everything was clean. The staff was helpful and polite and let me access a PC on the ground floor to print off some documents. Wifi was available for free and was generally good in the room, although occassionally sluggish. The room service - provided by Tamarind, the restaurant on the ground floor - seemed limited in range to me, particularly if you don't like Asian influenced food, so i didn't use it. (I ate in the restaurant itself one night and it was a good experience.) There are few eating options in the inmediate vicinity of the hotel - although if you walk towards the Garden District there are fast food places and coffee shops and a few other restaurants. Going towards the French District there is less choice until you get to Canal St. Most days i didn't eat in the hotel area, but made sure i ate before heading back. The exterior of the hotel is not particularly appealing - it looks more like an office block - and you have to get pretty close before you see the hotel sign by the door. In summary this is a good option if you want somewhere a little more quiet and which is not in the thick of the action. It's close enough to walk to most places you'd want to see but also allows easy access to transport options. I'd stay here again if in N.O.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!! Highly Recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at Hotel Modern and will definitely be returning for future New Orleans trips. Such a chic hotel! We were greeted with wine on our arrival. The staff is incredibly friendly and ready to assist you with all your needs. The hotel is clean and affordable. Rooms are a bit small, but we're not spending time in our room when we're in New Orleans. Beds are super comfortable. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Good room, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Louisa C
Reviews.Content: My sister and I have mixed feelings about this hotel after our stay, primarily due to the poor customer service we received during our stay. The room was spacious and nicely furnished with a very comfortable king bed. Unfortunately our room was right by the door that connects the main building and where our rooms where, this door banged fairly loudly all night as guests go in and out and shook the walls and disrupted what otherwise would have been a very restful sleep on the comfortable bed. Upon arriving we checked and asked about the parking (there is valet, self park or a car park at the back) we were informed rather cooly by the receptionist that as the hotel was not affiliated with the car park at the back of the hotel they could not provide us any information on it. Whilst I accept this answer, at better hotels with better customer service, I am sure given the number of enquiries they must receive on parking they would be able to offer some advice or assistance. The biggest problem we had was the minibar, which was not refilled from the previous guests and was half empty. After being told it would be refilled straight away to avoid us being charged for the missing items, we waited and waited and waited. Housekeeping finally arrived but were unaware of the minibar and was only here for turndown service. The housekeeper left saying she would inform someone to come up and refill. We waited again and after some time we finally called reception to advise them of the problem. I was simply told that yes they were aware, they were not sending someone up (despite us being told twice this would occur) and that we would not be charged. It would have been nice for reception to call us to confirm this to us rather than have us waiting around unable to relax thinking someone would be coming up to our room at any moment. Unfortunately a week after our stay a charge for $120 appeared on my sisters credit card for the minibar! Luckily after a few phone calls they said they would remove the charge, however it was a mistake made by the hotel that caused us to have spend time rectifying!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AmandaS05
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay, about a mile away from Bourbon St but easily accessible by the 24hr St. Charles cable car or a 20 min walk. Also close to the Garden District and Lafayette Cemetery #2. The small room is defiantly small but clean and comfortable; perfect for anyone who doesn't plan on sitting in the hotel room all day. 24hr gas station/ corner store and a cable car stop all just across the street. Cereal, pastries and coffee served in the morning. Great place to stay and a little less expensive since it's a little out of the way. The cable car is only $3 for a day pass which starts at midnight and ends at 4am the next morning (28 hours).

Reviews.Title: “Big easy made easy”
Reviews.Author: Captmav
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were met with smiles and wine! Great staff clean rooms comfortable beds. On trolley line or walk 8 blocks to quarter. Great free continental breakfast with healthy choices. Also they accepted our small dog. There is a pet fee. Loved it

Reviews.Title: “"it was a great hotel and great staff"”
Reviews.Author: boomer12
Reviews.Content: It was my 65th birthday celebration with my husband and our best friends....From the moment we walked in we were treated special. We found the staff to be very nice and very helpful...I would recommend this hotel, and I can't wait to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value- but not the "modern" standard”
Reviews.Author: Jenn N
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hotel Modern for 4 nights. Chose this hotel because of it's proximity to the convention center (5 blocks) and the modern style. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly staff and offered wine. Oddly they don't have a standard front desk and you have to wait to the side while the process and run your card in the back. I stayed in the small room, it had modern upgrades but many important upgrade/ details were missing. - The toilet looked very dirty, with large dark stains in the bottom, which I believe were just stains but it looked like poo. - Their website listed listed Ipod docks in rooms, on arrival mine didn't have one. When I called the front desk they informed me the hotel didn't have enough for every room and would contact me the next day to let me know if one was available, never got a call or an ipod dock. Glad I brought a back-up charger - There was no menu for room service or the min-bar in the room. I called to request a menu, it never was brought up. The last night I called again for a menu, was told it would be right up. After 20+ min still no menu, called the front desk again. Once I brought up the issue of being the 3rd call I was hung up on. About 10 min later the menu arrived. Dinner was ok and reasonable priced, though nothing special. - No iron in the room, had to call for one. The board delivered had a large stain on it. - While waiting for a colleague near the front desk I asked for a glass of the wine sitting out. I was very sharply asked if I received one when I checked in, I had... apparently its only for guesting checking in, there's no wine hour so don't expect any additional wine. - Looks like new bedding, but the desk and dresser were old, furniture in the hallways was all scrapped up, along with scrapped walls needing new paint. - Overall the hotel cheaply upgraded to modern. Needs re-painting, furnishes replaced, and the customer is lacking. Another important note is there's no other hotels or restaurants near by. You can catch the trolly or a cab, so factor that into your hotel cost. But for the $100 per night price its still a fairly clean and comfortable place to stay. Just don't expect a top level modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a very good stay!”
Reviews.Author: twilson231
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for the Memorial Day weekend to attend a weeding. We had car trouble on the way down called the hotel and told them we would be late checking in we were told no problem. We arrived at the hotel around 10pm and parked in the rear liked suggested on here. When we walked in the hotel there was no one there to greet us, no bell to ring for service. Already tired and exhausted we waited for about 10 min for someone to enter the front of the hotel. We gave them our name and our credit card, he took it to the back and we waited another 10 min for him to return with our key and credit card. We were never offered a glass of wine or anything! We proceeded to our room on the 9th floor room 901 right by the elevator. As soon as we opened the door the room smelled of smoke! We went back down stairs and explained we needed another room, they claimed to be sold out but when we asked for a refund they said let me see what I can do. 5min later a hotel repair man escorted us the room 218 a much larger room but the a/c didn't work...hence the repair man escort. So know we are pissed! Now the repair man moves us to room 318 the a/c worked but the room smelled like your grandmother's closet....we were to exhausted to complain again! No one every apologized or offered any complimentary...or even asked us how are stay was! I now see why the rooms were so cheap! Sorry Modern Hotel you will never have my business again! My advice pay a little more and get the service and amenities a hotel offers.

Reviews.Title: “Short trip”
Reviews.Author: curtgreen40
Reviews.Content: I agree with everything that was said. use the parking lot behind the hotel. use the trolley to the french quarter. nice bar on st charles street for a quick drink. comfrotable bed, nice bathroom and great view(from the 8th floor). the Air conditioner/heat is something that needs worked on...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tia T
Reviews.Content: Was a weekend getaway for my husband and I. The hotel has nice rooms and comfortable beds, the restaurants inside are nice as well with great food. The only downside was our room was located right near an entrance so every time some one would walk in & out the door, the door would slam! Also, the valet parking was $42 a night not including tip! There is a self parking lot directly behind the property that's $18 a day, and you can access the hotel from the rear entrance. We didn't find out about this until day 2. Overall, it's a nice hotel and you can access the street car to get to the French quarter or take a 5 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: D_Smith11
Reviews.Content: Hotel was $92, vallet parking $28!! This is a unique hotel it's 8 blocks from Bourbon Street, not by walking u have to catch the street car which runs every 10 to 15 minutes. There's also two clubs near,one which is part of d Hotel an d other in walking distance. the Vallet guy Archie was great at helping with everything if he didn't no he found out for us the staff were very friendly from checking in to checking out!! it rained that weekend an they had umbrellas for all the guess!! Our room was nice we got room 415 no noise we also had a window u could see d stadium it lights up at night different colors but we also could see d top an side of buildings which is ok for me the bathroom was average very clean only thing was d drainer didn't work so d water was stuck in d tub ok now d fridge was fully stocked from wine to beer an d drawer Next to d desk was also fully stocked with snacks an liquor tshirt a cap drunken pickles lol but very expensive but good ideal now the bed was very comfy an d pillows just right so yes I would recommend this Hotel to you oh yea I almost forgot u get a complimentary glass of wine when u check in an also theres a restaurant in d hotel didn't try it but d food smelled yummy an they do room service!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel though a 15 minute walk from the action”
Reviews.Author: timothymarkwebb
Reviews.Content: A pretty good hotel with large rooms and a good bar. Nice drinks and very relaxed. The location is a little bit off the French Quarter - a non negotiable $10 fixed fair or a 15 minute walk to Canal Street - but all in all pretty good. The lack of reception isn't quite so thankfully and there are staff to welcome you and offer a glass of wine or water on arrival. The bar is worth a visit and the prices are very reasonable. Worth a visit in a great, great city

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price!”
Reviews.Author: Cass1981
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary and loved it! The hotel was nicely updated and modern, as the name implies. The restaurant in the hotel is good and the bar across the courtyard is a great place to hang out and drink a vintage cocktail. I loved the warehouse/ arts district, lots of museums, art galleries, new restaurants and some shops. We also had no problem walking to the quarter, although it may be far for some. The rooms are small but if was no problem for us, the view made up for it!

Reviews.Title: “european feel”
Reviews.Author: larry h
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within 11/2 blocks of the WW11 museum and the Modern art Museum. The hotel has a european feel. The resturant is very good with some nice different dishes for breakfast and dinner. The valet parking is costly $40.00 per night. However there is a parking lot behind the hotel. Check rates carefully we received vastly differnt quotes for each of the couples booking rooms. The hotel agreed to give all the lowest rate. Our cost was $150 per night. There are no other resturants close, however the St. Charles trolly has stops within 1 block .Good location to tour the WW11 museum,but not near other toutist sites. The hotel has a indivualist feel not a "chain" Overall service was very good. Dinner will cost $90 or more per couple

Reviews.Title: “Good start with a rough ending.”
Reviews.Author: fishlip4u
Reviews.Content: I am a business traveler that basically spends the vast majority of my time on the road and in hotels. I was travelling from Georgia to Texas and decided to spend the night in New Orleans on 4/17/12. My wife booked the room for me, so other than where it was located and that the parking was supposed to be secure, I knew nothing about the hotel. When I arrived at the Hotel Modern, I was immediately impressed with the appearence of the hotel and its surroundings. My work truck, which is packed with expensive equipment, was valet parked in a secure area which is monitored 24/7 for $18.00 a day. When I entered the lobby, I was immediate greeted by the staff. After asking my name and inviting me to sit down, I was offered a glass of wine while I was checked in. During the check in process, the staff members chatted with me and explained the various amenities and offerings of the hotel. I planned to do some computer work in the morning and check out somewhat early, so I asked about breakfast and room service and was told that they began serving at 7 am. I was assigned room 906, which turned out to be on the front of the hotel and had an impressive view. The room is small, but stylish and provided all the comforts of home except for in-room coffee maker and there are no ice machines, but if you call room service, they will bring a bucket to your room. The hotel itself is not in the French Quarter, but is right on a trolly line, which runs every few minutes, and brings you directly to all the areas of interest. That evening, I had dinner in the French Quarter and did some siight-seeing, and after several hours, returned to the hotel. I woke up about 6 am, did some business related work, took a shower and about 7:20 am, I began trying to order room service. From that time, until about 9 am, I attempted to contact room service and kept reaching a recording. I called the front desk and explained what was happening and they assured me that they would contact room service directly, and have them call me back. It never happened. When I went to check out, I observed that the restaurant was open and a few people were inside having coffee, so I am unsure what the issue was that morning. I informed the person that checked me out of the problems that I had encountered and surprisingly, they offered nothing other than a half hearted apology and no explanation for the breakdown in service that morning. No coffee, no breakfast and a bad ending to an otherwise good stay

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: lil_koala
Reviews.Content: The hotel was enjoyable. The staff was extremely helpful anytime we needed anything at all. The rooms are a bit on the small side but were well appointed. The mini fridge is full of the mini bar items so if you plan on using it you'll have to make some room. The location is right next to the St.Charles street car line if you plan on using the public transportation. The only drawbacks would be the air conditioner-it kept cutting off whenever we stayed still for too long and the parking- we parked in a lot directly behind the hotel for $18.00 per 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great views.”
Reviews.Author: tgrimes33
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans for the Final Four and stayed at The Modern Hotel on St. Charles Ave. It is a very service oriented hotel and all of the staff was super nice. The rooms were a little small but not too small and very well decorated. The beds were super comfortable and everything was super clean. The only down side was that the wireless internet was down for a large portion of the time that we were there. The explanation was that the whole city was online about the Final Four and the city wasn't equipped to handle the load. That was a ridiculous answer and thus why I gave four stars instead of five. I didn't have problems getting online any where else I was in the city so the staff person was making excuses but had no clue what he was talking about. They have valet parking for $38 which is a little high but you can drive and park as much as you want. There is a Premium Parking lot just around the block that you can park for 24 hours for $25. That is what we did and had no problems. The rooms are a little more expensive that we usually pay but for the Final Four experience of being in the city it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Apathetic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Shomi P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night, the hotel was supposed to be charged to my client's card since he reserved it and used his card to reserve it. When I checked in the hotel, lobby person assured me it was only for incidentals. When I checked my bank statement I figured the charge was temporary, 2 weeks ago by and the charge was still on my card. I called them and explained the situation and they didn't show any care whatsoever. The person on the phone didn't do anything to help and said I'm sorry for the misunderstanding but we can't do anything to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular experience”
Reviews.Author: Sylmarie G
Reviews.Content: Is a unique hotel, the front desk is a peculiar table no computer. The service it's the best and for welcome drink serving wine. The rooms are very modern and clean. I recommend 100%

Reviews.Title: “Still Getting the Kinks Out”
Reviews.Author: BellaVendetta
Reviews.Content: Beautifully done, amazing bathrooms, great beds, and a great location. The front desk staff were always very helpful and were the wait staff. Only issues I had: the doormen who were never actually at the door (they would appear only after you entered or exited). The musty dampness as you walk into your room if the air hasn't been on in quite a while. In fact, my clothes would take on a horrible smell as a result. No hair dryers or ironing boards. I also had to request a phone, a clock, and other basics as none of them were in my room when I arrived. When I had a hair dryer requested, they gave me a broken one. Be aware that, yes, the rooms are tiny, but the bathrooms are quite large. That said, I don't think the pricing for this hotel was entirely worth it; but again, it is a great location and very stylish in it's decor, and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back...”
Reviews.Author: LizYNewJersey
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the lobby - the hotel has a nice vibe. The front desk is efficient and very nice. The bellhop was knowledgable and gave us some great ideas on things to do. The room was very clean and inviting. The WW11 musuem is within walking distance worth the trip. If you are going on a cruise the hotel is not to far from the docks. Of you are going to the French Quarter you can take the trolley literally in front of the hotel. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ScottL926
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Modern for a long weekend in NOLA and will definitely be back. The hotel sits right on Lee CIrcle in the Arts District aka the Warehouse District. The hotel itself is in great shape with a very modern, "hip" feel to it. There's even a parrot, Scarlet, in the lobby. The lobby feels like you've walked into someone's private library rather than a hotel. My room was on the 8th floor and while small, was perfect for thr weekend. This is New Orleans so you're probably not staying in your room much. The bathroom was fine for one although if two people were trying to get ready, it might be a squeeze due to the small sink and ledge vs. a countertop. The bed was very comfortable and I had no problems sleeping at night. They even provide an umbrella in the room to use although thankfully I never needed it. The location is very convenient. I love to walk, so walking form the hotel to the French Quarter was not a problem. If you don't want to walk, the St. Charles streetcar runs right past the hotel so you have easy access out to he Garden District or down to Canal where you can walk into the Quarter or connect with the Canal line. Nearby you have great attractions like the WWII Museum, the Contemporary Arts Center, galleries, etc. and much, much more nearby. Great food is everywhere in New Orleans and you have places like Cochon, Cochon Butcher, Capdeville, American Sector, and the Soda Shop (great breakfast biscuits!) in the area and so much more.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your $”
Reviews.Author: JamieJ11
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Always clean. Food is good. Beer is cold. Close to everything. One of my favorite hotels in my favorite city!

Reviews.Title: “Great changes”
Reviews.Author: janellbb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before when it was Hotel LeCirque and recently stayed since the remodel at the new Hotel Modern. One of the most welcome changes was the new bedding and just the fact that the hotel seems so much cleaner and more comfortable. One nice surprise was that we were checked in by the same desk clerk that we had the last time. Her name is Rebecca and she is so sweet and friendly. Also very knowledgeable about the city and things to do. We also enjoyed meeting Scarlett, the parrot in the lobby. Unusual but fun. I loved the wine on arrival. The room amenities and the honor bar were great but I would have liked coffee in the room. All in all a great improvement. I would recommend this hotel and I will stay there the next time I am in N. O. which I hope is very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: iluvdatiger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to book this hotel for the first weekend of Mardi Gras. All of the uptown parades roll right by this hotel before making their way down to Canal. We brought two other couples with us who had never been to mardi gras. This was a good way to ease someone into mardi gras who had never been. The crowd in front of the hotel was never more than one or two person deep. The hotel was nice, the rooms were cute, bed was big and comfy. Liked the CB Bigalo toiletries. Lovely bar called Bellocq downstairs. There was a restaurant called Tamarind also on the lower level but we did not get to try it. Room rate was very fair priced for mardi gras first weekend. There were a few quirky things that I thought may need to be adjusted. I know the hotel just reopened as Hotel Modern, so maybe these quirky things just started, but for one thing, they didn't allow you to get ice. The ice machines were empty. You had to call the front desk to have it delivered. This got annoying pretty quick, especially during parades when you are constantly making drinks in your room. We were literally going up to the front desk and asking for ice for each new drink. Another quirky thing was the check in desk, or lack thereof. It was really just a waist high kiosk with some ice water sitting atop it. There was a girl who stood beside the desk, who did not appear to be wearing a uniform. She turned out to be the desk clerk. I thought she was hanging out, drinking water at first! The really nice man who opened the door for me a few times turned out to be the doorman! Again, no uniform was worn by him either. I did recognize the maid because she had cute french maid uniform on! none of these are bad things, just quirky. There is an adorable Macaw or some sort of parrot who hangs out in the lobby as well. He has a big bird cage beside the water kiosk. Overall, I would def stay here again for first weekend of mardi gras. It would also be good for people who come to town for the WWII museum, it is one block over.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Modern”
Reviews.Author: deah1
Reviews.Content: Newly updated. Comfortable beds. Very clean. First assigned tiny, tiny room; changed to a slightly larger room. No coffee pot in room, no ironing board in room, guest must call for ice. Pleasant staff. Good location. Complimentary wine in the evenings. Cute parrot in the lobby. But NO coffee!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Chris T
Reviews.Content: Awesome rooms, awesome new lobby. Amazing Vietnamese food. Most innovative new Modern Hotel in NOLA. Love the pig!!

Reviews.Title: “READ THE REVIEWS, PEOPLE!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara W
Reviews.Content: Let me first began by saying..the first step I took was to read every review I could find on the internet about this particular hotel. Because I booked our flight during a hotel wkend, we were pretty much screwed which hotel we had a choice to stay. I was fortunate enough to book 4 of our 8 nites at Harrahs'. However, the other 4 nites scared me. I reluctantly booked our other 4 nites at Hotel Le' Cirque. Let me tell you...we couldn't have been happier. Apparently we were fortunate to get a room (BTW, using the previous reviews, we were smart enough to ask for a renovated room! Smart move) that was new all the way around!! New furniture, flat screen, fully tiled bathroom. The room was relatively small, but considering there were only two of us (and we didn't need it for a pit stop)...hello...how much room do you really need? It was very comfortable and guess what???? We were so impressed, we cancelled our other 4 nites at Harrahs and spent our entire 8 nites at Hotel Le' Cirque. The trolley stop is a half block from the hotel front and it wasn't scary walking at nite down St. Charles St. to the other quaint resturants (Delmonico's (yes, Emerils) E's, VooDoo BBQ, Sushi Brothers) or if you want, the trolley stops in front of all these resturants. The staff is wonderful (Magna, DJ, Melissa, Jennifer), but for the 5 star hotel clerk...you need to request REBECCA..absolutely, no better! Resturant and bar were still under remodel, but we still drank, got drunk and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! If ever in this town again...this will always be our 'go to' hotel!!!! BTW..we stayed 11/10/11 - 11/17/11, 6th floor.

Reviews.Title: “En Route Via NOLA”
Reviews.Author: NiMo416
Reviews.Content: It was a Saturday night in October when I staid only 1 night at Hotel Le Cirque en route to a Caribbean Cruise the next day. Itâ€™s a boutique style hotel in the Warehouse District of New Orleans; it is a healthy walk to the cruise Port. We walked it with our luggage and took about 15 minutes; we had the time and wanted to save on the cab ride. It is located just out side of the hustle and bustle of the French Quatre which I particularly like and 1 trolley ride into the downtown core. This hotel is currently refurbishing its lobby, courtyard and rooms. Unfortunately nothing was noted on the site or mentioned when I called prior to arrival that the hotel was under construction however the reception staff went out of there way to over compensate for the make shift lobby and inconvenience. This hotel is located on a round-about on St. Charles Street, it's an intimate spot away from the crowds so would recommend for families with small children, business travel, couples and weekend get-a ways with friends. There are 10 floors with many rooms on each floor. The rooms have a simple contemporary decor and offer 1 king or double bed. My room had a clear view of monument of Colonel Robert E.Lee in Lee Circle and the trolleys that pass by. I didn't find it noisy, more on the quieter side of town, or wasn't bothered by the lights that light up the front of the hotel. Once the dark drapes are closed you won't know that you are New Orleans We had two rooms one was an older rooms on the 7th floor where I staid and the newer renovated rooms on the 5th floor where my friends staid. Each room had comfortable beds, spacious bathrooms, and basic amenities.The furniture more contemporary than the older rooms. I am lead to believe that the rooms are slightly larger than some of the Brand name hotels in the French Quatre. I would definitely go back just to see how Le Cirque looks after the reservations. It's a good location for groups travelling out of the New Orleans cruise port. It's walking distance to the Louisiana's Civil War Museum and The National World War II Museum. Also a good location if you're looking for a reasonable rate, the hotel is driving distance to the Mercedes-Benz Superdome as it's right by the US Route 90. The Door Man and hotel Manager recommended some great spots to eat, we tried them and were pleasantly impressed with both of their suggestions. The Front Desk Staff were very hospitable with all the guest. A great retreat to come back to from the excitement of streets of NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: andigger
Reviews.Content: Le Cirque offers a great location right on Lee Circle... the streetcars pass directly in front headed either uptown or to the Quarter. Its also easy walking distance to two museums (DDay and Confederate History) as well as great eats (Cochon Butcher and Deanies). I was there for Tulane Homecoming and the city was booked. I read reviews of the hotel which indicated the rooms while nice were small. I disagree, there was plenty of room, and while not spacious, was what was needed and not tight or cramped. They were in the process of rennovating the lobby and other areas and the reopened hotel promises to be even better.

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: vacationneededs53
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans for a meeting and had no choice over my selection of hotels. If you have to stay at this hotel DO NOT GET A ROOM FACING LEE SQUARE. The flashing lights on the front of the Hotel go on ALL NIGHT. The curtains do not fit propertly and there is no black out shade. Room was SMALL and tight to move around in. Lighting is the other issue, not enough. Great location if you are working or visiting in the Lee Circle area. Others in our party had a nicer room on the higher floors. Wish I would have taken pics to show the difference. The hotel was under renovation the fire alarm went off the next morning at 8 am when we were trying to pack and leave. Yes you had to exit the building and wait for the all clear.

Reviews.Title: “B- Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 214Solutions
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean,no frills,bare amenities and modest. Great place if you just wanna lay n bed and watch tv. If u are a museum buff....this spot is for u. (location wise)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for someone who wants to see all of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jtindover
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is older like most buildings in the area. The location on Lee Circle makes getting around great! The rooms are small and not very modern. However you don't seem to mind as it fits into the character of the place. The staff was very informative and the rooms clean. We would leave in the morning and get back to the room at about 10pm. The rates are reasonable we went for JazzFest and we just wanted a decent place to stay! Le Cirque met our needs. This is not the place to go if you want the feel of a resort!

Reviews.Title: “Upsides, downsides about evenly balanced, but know before you go.”
Reviews.Author: PetePoodle
Reviews.Content: Upsides - the nicest desk staff ever. The hotel's location right on the St. Charles streetcar line makes it a snap to get to Magazine Street antiquing or the French Quarter. Nice marble bath. Downsides; the world's smallest, darkest room. Until the sun goes down, at which point the ever-changing light show begins outside - and on your ceiling, too, despite heavy drapes. Either bring a slumber mask, or perhaps ask for a room on the BACK. Ice machines broken on all but one floor. And NO PLACE within walking distance with decent food. Avoid the St. Charles Cafe at all costs; the only bad food I had in the whole state, and it was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but consitent and clean”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a modern vibe and the rooms are clean. I have stayed here many times and use it as a fall back when I can not get a room closer to the French Quarter. The distance from the quarter is such that you must take a cab, the trolley or drive to the French Quarter. Be prepared to pay for internet access and a premium for parking. It is best if you do not have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible--but not great.”
Reviews.Author: cturp
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New Orleans and we wanted to stay somewhere affordable. Hotel Le Cirque has lots of potential and a very modern decor. However, the lobby has a sort of run down and dirty look to it. Our room was nice with modern furnishings... however, it was extremely cramped and small. One good point is the proximity to the WW2 museum and restaurant which we were able to leisurely walk to--this was truly the highlight of our trip. If you are staying for a short time and spending the majority of your time outside your hotel room, this might be an okay choice.

Reviews.Title: “So much potential!”
Reviews.Author: hennaeel
Reviews.Content: I got a room here pretty cheap last minute, so I wasn't sure what to expect. It was better than I thought, but with a little love it could be a great place. Le Cirque was recently bought out by another company, so they're in a weird transition period with someone telling me it would be a great place in October. Decor-wise, it seemed sort of flashy at first (more on that). The bar is not open yet, but looked ok from what I saw. Pros: -Absolutely wonderful staff. Everyone was friendly and genuine -Nice, redone bathroom with a big shower. -While not in the French Quarter, its right next to the Civil War Museum and WW2 Museum, and only a .5 mile walk from the convention center. Lots of restaurants around, and there is a trolley stop nearby. -The room was very clean. Worth improving: -New beds are needed. Mine was sort of soft and worn -While the decor in the room, lobbies, etc was nice, it was clear that things had been dinged up a bit and were old and needed to be fixed and replaced. The furniture looks nice at first, but there are scratched. And, please, rip up those dirty rugs in the elevators! -The window in the room was tiny, but had a nice view of the city. I wonder if there's an easy way to get more natural light in the rooms. -The heat in the hallways was literally cranked to ninety degrees. Ugh! All in all, not a bad place, but it needs some work. I'd like to stay again, but not not until after the renovations are complete so I can see what it's going to be like. Here's hoping Le Cirque becomes a fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but not the worst.”
Reviews.Author: evalano07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as a last minute family vacation to New Orleans. Trying to escape the hot, humid weather that is New Orleans, only to walk into the front area that felt equally as hot and humid. Our room was very small. As one reviewer did point out, there was a musty, mildew odor. The room overall was clean looking but didn't feel clean. Very dated and in much need of some remodeling. Although front desk service was prompt in delivering extra towels when requested. No refrigerator in the room, but a coffee maker is always a plus. The St. Charles streetcar is just outside the front door of the hotel, but we ended up driving to the French Quarter which was only a couple of blocks away. The hotel is across from the highway so easy access to 1-10. I have stayed in much nicer hotels for less than the cost of this one.Overall, an average hotel but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED THIS HOTEL! THIS IS OUR HOME AWAY FROM HOME!”
Reviews.Author: MsNichelle
Reviews.Content: As a first time mom and away from home and our children for the first time since two years, I didn't think I was going to make it, but I have to thank the hotel, it's upscale room, soft and comfy bed, and totally awesome staff who made our trip 100% awesome. I swear to return to New Orleans, and stay at the Cirque. If you are traveling by train, it's a short walk to the hotel. Then you have a trolley at the door step to take you all over the city. Awesome, Awesome, Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Super nice staff, but need details fixed for a better stay.”
Reviews.Author: Mazzy0774
Reviews.Content: Okay first room was too small. They gave us second room that was bugger. But, every channel Came on tv snowy, no fridge, no hit water, 2 towels and notuch attention to detail. We got switched to 3rd room to find no tub. I LOVE bath time at night and couldn't believe there was no tub. BUT, the hotel is nice. The staff was amazing from the get go. We were told to come again after renovation so we might try it again. Great location. St Charles tavern down the street was very tasty food and its Just a $7 cab ride to Bourbon St. Also, only one elevator working sucked. Beds were awesome though. Good hot water in last room and great water pressure. We were comped half of room.

Reviews.Title: “No breakfast and misleading website”
Reviews.Author: khimjiv
Reviews.Content: When i travel i need a gym and a spa, etc to relax after the end of the day. This hotel said it had these but was 5 blocks away, very dissapointed, so for 7 nights I did not have a fitness program because the information was incorrect. Also - one of the websites sad there was breakfast included, how can a hotel not have a restruant to eat. any way, I know that even cheaper places have these facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Not close to anything really.”
Reviews.Author: MichiganLadybug
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying the staff is friendly and the furnishings are mostly nice and modern and they let us check in early but the location is not great umless you want to ride the street car and visit the gearden district, we walked 10 blocks just to get to canal st. Also parking is 25 bucks in an open lot a block away. The room and bathroon are really small with a glass frosted to to the bathroom.The bedding is nice but we slept really bad from the toilet running really loud every 15 min and the loud street car outside,It was also a maze to get to our room and there was wet paint on the walls and plastic on the floor in the hall, no breakfeast or pool or anything really, great for a single person on business, that's about it, would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “"Cockroaches par for course"”
Reviews.Author: Melanie128
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on trip advisor and it takes a lot for me to write this since I consider myself to be a pretty laid back traveler. The experience I just had was so horrific I have to share. My boyfriend and I checked into le cirque for a 3 night stay. Check in went smoothly, room was fine- a little wear and tear but nothing we couldn't handle On the morning of our second day I was getting ready in the bathroom and turned around to see a GIGANTIC cockroach crawling along the bathtub. I was horrified, I never saw a bug that size in my life. My boyfriend was outside so I called the front desk to have someone come up and kill this thing. Ten minutes later a maintenance worker and what seemed to be a manager (no one introduced themselves so I'm really not sure) arrived with nothing but a rubber glove to kill the bug. They took care of the bug and just walked out of the room without an apology or even spraying or cleaning anything!! I was visibly shaken up by the whole thing and really didn't feel comfortable staying in the room. My boyfriend went down to the front desk to see what options were available for us. The front desk associate at that time was very understanding- she apologized offered us a different room and ensured it would be thoroughly cleaned. She also stated that she would make a note on our bill for a discounted rate for our troubles. The new room was ok- same as the previous room, no cockroaches that I could see so it sufficed for our last night. Upon checkout in the morning we spoke with a different associate and explained the situation and fact that a previous associate noted a discount due to bugs. This associate said there were no notes and there was nothing she could do to discount the room rate. She was very unapologetic and stated that "cockroaches were par for course this time of year." Needless to say we had terrible experience and will be working with expedia (who we booked with) and the better business bureau to discuss. New Orleans otherwise was a great time, save the hassle and stay somewhere else though.

Reviews.Title: “slightly shabby but clean and extremely friendly”
Reviews.Author: ajm2167
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by the service at Le Cirque. The staff were increadibly friendly in a genuine way and very helpful. The hotel is a restrained mod design. Corners cwere cut with materials so some of the finishes are showing wear and tear, but otherwise I thought the hotel was great. And it was well located far enough from the French Quarter to escape the madness but not so far that it wasn't a comfortable walk. It is also close to the Garden District and several museums. And it was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Belle711
Reviews.Content: I was just recently at this hotel with three other friends, and we all agreed on the fact that this is not somewhere we'd stay at again. Our room was on the second floor and the elevator was always working so that wasn't a problem. However, the room always smelled like mold, it was muggy and the sheets were stained.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible but not good either”
Reviews.Author: regan82975
Reviews.Content: Le Cirque is on Lee Circle which is a cab ride to the French Quarter. The room we had was pretty small and the bed (king size) was uncomfortable. The bathroom was pretty small as well and not very clean. The stand up shower had some mold in the floor area and was pretty creepy. Parking is an additional $28/night so be careful if you are driving. The lobby was cool-ish but the bar was never open while we were there nor did they have breakfast. All in all, it was alittle less value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Although the staff is nice, do not waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: Travelsindiinero
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling for business since Feb (the past 2 months) leaving home every third day to stay in hotels. By far, this one was the worst. The positive reviewers are guilty of hyperbole or work for the company. I booked a "deluxe room" w/a King-sized bed for 2 nights, but upon my arrival was assigned a closet sized room w/a full-sized bed. I opened the door and was immediately greeted by a strong odor, perhaps mold, but certainly an unpleasant dampness. The small room was depressing, w/only one small window facing an alley and the backs of several nearby buildings. There was a small area separated from the rest of the room by a dingy curtain; I pulled the curtain back to discover the "closet". The bathroom was about 1/3 the size of the entire room, which surpised me. The bathroom counter appears to have been actual marble, though I cannot be certain. The shower consisted of a tiled area marked off by a curtain. All the furniture was old and ragged. The desk chair, which was covered in vinyl, looked as if an animal had been chewing on it or a previous customer had carelessly peeled it off the seat and the back of the chair. The carpet, both in the room and the elevator, was absolutely filthy. I knew I would not be able to spend two nights in that room and went downstairs to request a room change. The ladies at the desk apologized profusely about the smelly room and said they would "upgrade" me to the room for which my office had already prepaid. I visited the new room before accepting it and it was only slightly better. There were 2 small windows w/the exact same view and the carpet appeared less disgusting. The room is significantly smaller and certainly not worth Amy extra cost. In total, I can say that this is the worst hotel I've stayed in the US. It needs major renovations of the rooms and an overhaul of it's decor and furnishings. My room's walls seem to be freshly painted, but the timy bathroom of my new room is painfully in need of repair and re-painting. It is worth mentioning that there is only one functioning elevator in the hotel, though there are two elevators. I can see adventurers, college students and people who can sleep anywhere being satisfied w/a place of this caliber; however, it will not suffice for anyone requiring clean and comfortable accommodations. The price is only a few dollars less than large hotel chains; chains I would have preferred if it were not an issue of lack of rooms due to several large conferences coinciding w/my trip to New Orleans. Do not be fooled by the positive reviews; this hotel needs A LOT of improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, modern hotel. Staff that goes above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Dmprintz
Reviews.Content: From the moment I reserved the hotel room, weeks in advance of the actual trip - I found that the service was spectacular. I had to call the hotel with inquiries about amenities, parking, etc. They were incredibly helpful and genuinely enthused about their job. Once there, the check-in was pleasant and efficient - they set up our valet parking and helped us to our room. Our trip was one of leisure and escape - the environment of the hotel and the staff succeeded in making that easy. Laura and Rebecca, the lovely ladies behind the desk for the day shift were absolutely wonderful in every way. They helped us find things to do, made reservations for meals and personally took time out of their work to congratulate us on our engagement. I have one negative review. The maintenance guy, when called upon to repair an issue with our television, was impatient, rude and seemed inconvenienced by the fact that we required his oh so valuable time to repair their broken television, which he ended up just replacing. Aside from that, I couldn't have anything but the highest review for the staff and the experience at Hotel Le Cirque. I would suggest it to all of my friends and I will personally be taking my FiancÃ© back the soonest we have a chance!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the friendly staff & modern decor!”
Reviews.Author: slwarren26
Reviews.Content: Came here with my little boy and best friend for my birthday weekend. They let us check in early and the valet guys were super nice. The front desk lady showed me how to get to the attractions we were looking for and gave me local insider information on the best way to get to the cemetaries and shops. Our room was clean and cozy; it wasn't as big as most chain hotel rooms, but I almost prefered the home-y feeling. The decor was amazing and the climate control in the room was easy to use and quick. The ONLY negative I found was there were not ice machines on every floor. I went on a fifteen minute adventure seeking one out. Other than that, it was great and will definatley stay there agian!

Reviews.Title: “LUCKY FIND !”
Reviews.Author: WorldCitizenHDF
Reviews.Content: traveling with friends for my bday, we love to party but we need a good night sleep, so we didnt wanna be in the middle of Bourbon St. Also, we weren't looking for something expensive. This hotel is the perfect distance from Bourbon St. The St. Charles streetcar stops right across from the hotel & it's about 2-3 stops from Bourbon (5 min.) It's a 10 min walk, & you see nice parks & cozy diners along the way. Taxis are also readily available. The staff was super nice & helpful. When i made the reservation i asked for an earlier check in time because our flight landed early in the day, & it was no problem. The rooms are very clean, modern & the perfect size. tip- if you're out late in Bourbon St., you might find quite a few people waiting to board the streetcar. if you're on a budget & traveling with 3-4 people, take a taxi, you'll pay the same between you for a cab, than you would each for the streetcar.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE AND DO NOT VALET!!!! YOU WILL GET YOUR CAR BROKEN INTO!!”
Reviews.Author: southwesttx
Reviews.Content: The first day of my stay, my car was broken into and i valet it!! They park your car in a open lot with no security. My car was not the only car broken into either. there were others too. So be careful when you valet. The valet said they would pay for everything and fix it the next day but none of that happened. All i got was the run around and they made me stay a extra day but still didnt fix it so i had no choice but to drive home and fix it in houston. I had to drive 6 hours home with a plastic guard that the valet guaranteed would not be loud and would stay on. It flew off the first 15 mins of driving! Its been 3 weeks now and i been calling and leaving voicemails but no one calls back. I was promised everything would be paid for and taken care of, now there saying they didnt say that! Wow worst vacation and stay of my life. BEWARE OF THE VALET. your car is not safe with them.

Reviews.Title: “Met our Needs with Professionalism, Friendliness, and Promptness”
Reviews.Author: kater523
Reviews.Content: We rented 4 clean, modern and well-equipped rooms at the Hotel Le Cirque for a Convention. It was a 10 minute walk to the Convention Center and was on the trolley line so we could get to the French Quarter and other fun places quickly. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful! They were more than accommodating in any way they could help. The only drawbacks were that we happened to be across the hall from the ice machine, which was a bit noisy. The hotel lights on the outside facade where cool, but at night, annoyed me a bit. I would have liked the curtains to be wider; that would have helpful. The lobby bar was not operational, which was disappointing. I would have loved access to a pool, a hot tub or a masseuse as our feet were in pain after walking miles each day. Overall, though, it was perfect for our needs- clean rooms, good beds, and good location!

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Misswags
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because of the location and mostly positive reviews. We booked a room with 2 double beds but none were available when we checked in so we were "upgraded" to a king with a futon. The bathroom sink leaked all over the floor, the walls are paper thin, the fire alarm was ripped out of the wall and the paint was peeling. No breakfast or room service, and they didn't have sugar for the coffee makers. It was requested but never delivered to the room. Only 1 of the elevators works and the stairwell stunk. The place may have been nice at 1 time, but you'd be better off at a quality inn now. Some of the staff are very nice, but it's luck of the draw. Overall it was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Wecanreviewu
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended this hotel while we stayed in New Orleans three days before our cruise. We were very impressed with the staff who went out of their way to help us, always enthusiastic and eager to assist! The hotel is reasonably priced with average clean and fairly modern accomodations. It is close enough that we walked all our tours directly from the hotel to the Canal Street, the French Sector, the Riverfront, IMAX cinema, the French Market etc. The hotel is on Lee Circle in the business sector which is also on the street car route so it's very convenient.

HotelInfo.Name: The Hotel Modern
HotelInfo.Address: 936 St. Charles Avenue, At Lee Circle, New Orleans, LA 70130
